title: [Epidemiology] With coronavirus shelter-in-place orders in effect, the odds that a non-natural death occurred were 14.4% below expected levels. Sheltering-in-place policies likely reduce mortality from mechanisms unrelated to infection or other natural causes of death.

[Biology] SARS-CoV-2 jumped from bats to humans without much change. Since December 2019 and for the first 11 months of the SARS-CoV-2 pandemic there has been very little 'important' genetic change observed in the hundreds of thousands of sequenced virus genomes.
